sentences.chinese: 然而，我们必须小心谨慎。

sentences.english: A couple of years ago, though, curiosity overcame caution.
sentences.chinese: 可是，数年以前，我的好奇心战胜了谨慎。

sentences.english: They are too conscientious and responsible to drive like manias .
sentences.chinese: 妇女格外谨慎，责任心也强，不会像狂人一样开飞车。

sentences.english: Still, there's reason to be cautious aboutthe findings.
sentences.chinese: 然而，运用这个发现的成果仍需要谨慎。

sentences.english: One must be very careful when comparing ORAC scores.
sentences.chinese: 在进行ORAC数据对比时，我们应该小心谨慎。

sentences.english: Nissan's Nakamura said he is 'cautious' about 2012.
sentences.chinese: 日产的中村公泰说，他对2012年的预测很谨慎。

sentences.english: He phrased his criticisms in careful terms.
sentences.chinese: 他的批评用词十分谨慎。

sentences.english: This conclusion should be regarded warily for several reasons.
sentences.chinese: 对这一结论的认可应持谨慎态度。

sentences.english: Mr. Uribe, one of the targets of the alleged assassination plots, reacted cautiously.
sentences.chinese: 暗杀阴谋的目标之一乌力贝对此反应谨慎。

sentences.english: One should be very careful with what he thinks.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都应该对他的想法谨慎。

sentences.english: I hate people who are treated nicely for athletics.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌那些因为体育活动而被谨慎对待的人。

sentences.english: They require a careful step-by-step approach over many years.
sentences.chinese: 它们要求在今后许多年中采用谨慎的逐步解决的方式。

sentences.english: Henry and Hannah almost immediately became more careful spenders.
sentences.chinese: 亨利和汉娜的消费立即变得更谨慎了。

sentences.english: Another prejudice is the belief that policy should move cautiously.
sentences.chinese: 另一个偏见就是认为制定政策应该小心谨慎。

definition: to be on the alert/vigilant/alert/on guard/to warn
to guard against/to be vigilant/watch you don't (slip)/also pr. [ti2 fang2]
to be mindful/to pay attention to/to take note of
to wait and see/to watch from the sidelines/to look around/to survey
treat sth lightly/to lower one's guard
think three times then go (idiom); don't act before you've thought it through carefully
think again and again before acting (idiom); consider carefully in advance
